title: Find the derivative graph from a function graph

content.question: Which of the following could be the graph of an antiderivative of f ?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 through 2 are indicated on the x axis. The curve is symmetric over the y axis. The curve begins on the x axis at negative 2 and moves upward and to the right. It then levels off, reaching a high point above the x axis, between the values x equals negative  2 and x equals negative 1. It then moves downward and to the right crossing the x axis slightly to the right of negative 1, and levels off, crossing the y axis below the origin. It then moves upward and to the right crossing the x axis again, slightly to the left of 1. It then levels off, reaching a high point above the x axis between x equals 1 and x equals 2. The curve then moves downward and to the right until it ends at 2 on the x axis.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 through 2 are indicated on the x axis. The curve is symmetric about the origin. The curve begins on the x axis at negative 2 and moves upward and to the right until it levels off, reaching a high point above the x axis, between x equals negative 2 and x equals negative 1. It then moves downward and to the right crossing the x axis slightly to the right of negative 1, and levels off, reaching a low point between x equals negative 1 and the y axis. It then moves upward and to the right passing through the origin, and levels off, reaching a high point between the y axis and x equals 1. It then moves downward and to the right crossing the x axis again, slightly to the left of 1, and levels off, reaching a low point below the x axis between x equals 1 and x equals 2. The curve then moves upward and to the right until it ends at 2 on the x axis.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 through 2 are indicated on the x axis. The curve is symmetric about the origin. The curve begins on the x axis at negative 2 and moves downward and to the right, until it levels off, reaching a low point below the x axis, between x equals negative 2 and x equals negative 1. It then moves upward and to the right crossing the x axis slightly to the right of negative 1, and levels off, reaching a high point between x equals negative 1 and the y axis. It then moves downward and to the right passing through the origin, and levels off, reaching a low point between the y axis and x equals 1. It then moves upward and to the right crossing the x axis again, slightly to the left of 1, and levels off, reaching a high point above the x axis between x equals 1 and x equals 2. The curve then moves downward and to the right until it ends at 2 on the x axis.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 through 2 are indicated on the x axis. The curve is symmetric about the origin. The curve begins in quadrant 3 below the x axis at x equals negative 2. R moves downward and to the right until it levels off, reaching a low point between x equals negative 2 and x equals negative 1. R then moves upward and to the right passes through the origin, and levels off, reaching a high point in quadrant 1 between x equals 1 and x equals 2. On the interval on which the curve is moving upward, the curve is increasingly steep from the low point until a point slightly to the right of x equals negative 1, then becomes less steep until a point slightly left of x equals 1, then becomes steeper until leveling off at the high point. The curve then moves downward and to the right until it ends in quadrant 1 above  the x axis value 2.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with origin labeled O. The numbers negative 2 through 2 are indicated on the x axis. The curve is symmetric about the origin. The curve begins in quadrant 3 below the x axis at x equals negative 2. R moves downward and to the right until it levels off, reaching a low point between x equals negative 2 and x equals negative 1. R then moves upward and to the right passes through the origin, and levels off, reaching a high point in quadrant 1 between x equals 1 and x equals 2. On the interval on which the curve is moving upward, the curve is increasingly steep from the low point until a point slightly to the right of x equals negative 1, then becomes less steep until a point slightly left of x equals 1, then becomes steeper until leveling off at the high point. The curve then moves downward and to the right until it ends in quadrant 1 above  the x axis value 2.

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
